snippet: By not prosecuting anyone for the brutal deaths of two prisoners held in C.I.A. custody, it could happen again.
abstract: Editorial laments that there is no hope for imposing meaningful accountability for torture and other abuses committed against prisoners under Pres George W Bush's administration; decries Atty Gen Eric Holder Jr's announcement that no one will be prosecuted for the brutal deaths of two prisoners held in CIA custody; warns that in the absence of any sort of legal accountability, there is no assurance that such lawless practices will not be used again.
lead_paragraph: By not prosecuting anyone for the brutal deaths of two prisoners held in C.I.A. custody, it could happen again.
